New Records: Andrew Benintendi hit his 20th home run of the season, matching a career high
Key Match Events: White Sox fell to Tigers 4-1, marking their 121st loss, surpassing the modern-day record held by the 1962 New York Mets
Pre-Game Insights: Sox starter Sean Burke pitched five scoreless innings despite a 2-hour, 20-minute rain delay
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Grady Sizemore praised the team's resilience and effort, noting they 'aren't folding'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the Sox's second victory in 12 chances in the season series
White Sox designated hitter Bryan Ramos hit a solo home run in the second inning
